text:
Hi! I am trying to start the testnet validator, (v0.4.4) using docker-compose setup. But validator service is unhealthy and crashing with error.
```{"@timestamp":"2025-07-15T11:21:19.013Z","@version":"1","message":"Failed to read config at startup: Error(List(com.typesafe.config.ConfigException$Parse: /app/additional-config.conf: 41: Expecting close brace } or a comma, got '0' ('+' not followed by =, '0' not allowed after '+') (if you intended '0' ('+' not followed by =, '0' not allowed after '+') to be part of a key or string value, try enclosing the key or value in double quotes, or you may be able to rename the file .properties rather than .conf)))","logger_name":"o.l.splice.SpliceApp$","thread_name":"main","level":"ERROR","level_value":40000}```
Filled all the `.env` file properly and also started the node with (filling those with proper values):
```./start.sh -s "<SPONSOR_SV_URL>" -o "<ONBOARDING_SECRET>" -p "<party_hint>" -m "<MIGRATION_ID>" -w```

text: Hi - I'm playing with changing the `OPERATOR_WALLET_USER_ID` of our DevNet validator. When I create a new user in Auth0 and assign that user to `OPERATOR_WALLET_USER_ID` , I can login to the Wallet UI of that NEW user and see the correct balance, but oddly enough I can still login as the OLD `OPERATOR_WALLET_USER_ID` user and see the same balance? Is that expected?

text:
Hi Team, we are trying to upgrade our TestNet to 0.4.4. I was able to upgrade `postgres` and `participant` but while trying to upgrade validator, I'm getting the below message. Any idea what is causing this. Thanks in Advance!

```helm upgrade validator <oci://ghcr.io/digital-asset/decentralized-canton-sync/helm/splice-validator> -n validator --version ${CHART_VERSION} -f splice-node/examples/sv-helm/validator-values.yaml -f splice-node/examples/sv-helm/standalone-validator-values.yaml --wait
Pulled: <http://ghcr.io/digital-asset/decentralized-canton-sync/helm/splice-validator:0.4.4|ghcr.io/digital-asset/decentralized-canton-sync/helm/splice-validator:0.4.4>
Digest: sha256:0b5826d1ef7ba247421570db92cbf3c831600b325d91e2c6fab10fd5499be323
Error: UPGRADE FAILED: another operation (install/upgrade/rollback) is in progress```

elements.text: Hi Team, we are trying to upgrade our TestNet to 0.4.4. I was able to upgrade

text:
Hey Canton builders :wave:
We’ve been working on a SDK to simplify connecting to any Canton node or validator,
& we’re excited about its potential: *<https://sdk.canton.fairmint.com>*

*What’s inside so far*
• Strongly‑typed wrappers for the `ledgerAPI` & `validatorAPI` (read + write).
• Auto‑refreshing auth token & sensible defaults for `actAs`, `commandId`, etc.
• Helpers that chain common tasks (e.g., create‑party‑if‑missing, grant self‑permissions).
• Input checking and lightweight logging to speed up debugging.
*Why we built it*
At <http://Fairmint.com|Fairmint.com>, we’re constantly wiring Canton into our products. Re-writing glue code was getting old,
so we created this to streamline our work - and now, yours.
Our goal is to open-source it to reduce friction for everyone building on the network & accelerate the ecosystem’s growth.

*The plan*
We’re aiming to release this SDK publicly, and we want to ensure it’s robust & meets community needs.
To make that happen, we would appreciate support (_think sponsorship, collaboration_) to polish it up (_e.g., adding websockets, scanAPI, and more_).
Think of what web3.js, ethers.js, or viem became with community backing; we could do something similar here.

*How you can help*
• Share your thoughts: would this SDK be useful for your projects? how? 
• Suggest features or integrations you’d want to see.
• Let us know if you or your team are interested in supporting this effort to get it released faster.
More to come as we keep building on Canton at Fairmint.
Ping me with questions, feedback, or ideas, and let’s make this SDK a game-changer for Canton builders!

Happy hacking :technologist:

Happy hacking
